result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey L Steinhagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Expungment after 1 year if no further criminal activity and fines and costs paid.
Defendant to submit DNA sample at the Sheriff's Dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey L Steinhagen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Casey L Steinhagen not in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review for eligibility of expungement...CCAP reviewed and Oconto Case 16CM83 pending case, probable cause found and future plea/sentencing scheduled.  Therefore, Judge declares expungement denied.

Defendant Casey L Steinhagen in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doesn't qualify for the PD.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Court orders $250 fine + costs, DNA surcharge, Expungment after 1 year.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Casey L Steinhagen in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  DA recommends $250 fine + costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  Rights explained.  Defendant doesn't understand.  Court advises defendant he should speak with an attorney.  Bond continues with all conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
